1085703277344362496.text: More than 24h of intense contract scanning (together with @trailofbits and @kolinko). Found multiple cases of contracts that would become vulnerable to reentrancy with EIP-1283, however none of these result in critical exploits. More updates to follow tomorrow.

964212372624703488.text: Security has a concept called attack surface: the more kinds of exposures, the greater the attack surface. Similarly we can think of governance as having an argument surface: the more kinds of decisions there are to argue over, the less functional the institution will be.

1012281610119639040.text: One of the hottest topics of these days: What is difference between ZKSnarks and ZKStarks? Snarks rely on pairings (not quantum resistant) and need a trusted setup phase while Starks don't and are post quantum secure. Read this article for more infohttps://medium.com/coinmonks/zk-starks-create-verifiable-trust-even-against-quantum-computers-dd9c6a2bb13d …
